channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16646] Enhance LoadIncrementalHFiles API to accept store file paths as input
item.description:
Currently LoadIncrementalHFiles takes the directory (output path) as input parameter.

In some scenarios (incremental restore of bulk loaded hfiles), the List of paths to hfiles is known.

LoadIncrementalHFiles can take the List as input parameter and proceed with loading.
item.summary: Enhance LoadIncrementalHFiles API to accept store file paths as input

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Patch v0 illustrates the tentative change.

List of hfiles may be retrieved from BulkLoadDescriptor.
In patch v1, signatures of public methods are kept.

how does it find which family the file belongs to? is the assumption here that you have the family name as parent dir?
so something like LoadIncremental /myStoreFile does not work but something like LoadIncremental /myFamily/myStoreFile works?

In the map:

Map<byte[], List<Path>> map

key is family.
value is List of Paths each of which contains family.

-1 overall

Patch v2 fixes javadoc and findbugs warnings.

public int run(String dirPath, Map<byte[], List<Path>> map, TableName tableName) throws Exception{

map is not being used. You ned to call the new doBulkLoad api written.

public void prepareHFileQueue(Map<byte[], List<Path>> map, Table table,
Deque<LoadQueueItem> queue, boolean validateHFile, boolean silence) throws IOException {

validateHFile parameter is not used, can be removed.

Can you also add test case covering this scenario.

For test case, that would be covered by HBASE-14417.
Is that Okay ?

Will address the other review comments in next patch.
Since this is a public and stable class, IMHO its better to add it here and lets not mix it with HBASE-14417 as this by itself is a independent jira.
Patch v3 adds test which exercises the new API.

-1 overall

Is it possible that we don't have the added run method?

import java.util.HashMap;

Unused import, not sure why checkstyle didn't report it. Can be addressed on commit if there is no other review comments.

The added run method checks config parameter such as SILENCE_CONF_KEY.
I think it should be kept.

Turns out I need to maintain the original cleanup logic since prepareHFileQueue() may throw IOE.
Addendum extracts the cleanup code into its own method and moves the try / finally block into doBulkLoad().
